title: A Culture of Caring
content: When Bailey Krais, RN, goes to work in the neonatal intensive care unit at Baylor University Medical Center (BUMC), she provides care to some of the smallest patients in Texas- some born at just 22 weeks gestation. In Bailey’s hands is a tiny patient and an immense responsibility, one she considers a deep and sacred privilege.

title: 25th Anniversary Celebrating Women Luncheon
content: 25th Anniversary Celebrating Women Luncheon Featured Guest Olivia Munn Celebrating Women Celebrating Women has been committed to advancing the fight against breast cancer in North Texas for 25 years. Since this effort launched in 1999, together, we have raised more than $40 million to fuel innovative research, advance early detection and create patient-centered programs to […]

title: 7 nutritious snack choices to make while traveling
content: Traveling, whether by car or plane, often has its challenges—especially when it comes to sticking to your nutrition and wellness goals. Stopping by a fast-food restaurant, gas station or airport kiosk often seems like the only option to fuel our bodies when traveling. But with a bit of planning and knowledge, it’s entirely possible to […]
